page.title: 10Interview with a resident.
page.content: Mr. Frank Howell has lived in Moreton Morrell since 1950. He was formerly Vice-Principal of the College of Agriculture, but has now retired. The children asked him about houses built in the last 35 years. They are:- 3 council houses at the top of Duffus Hill, the houses in Fuller Place, 8 houses on the southern side of Brook Lane, Nicholaston' Brook Lane, 48 council houses in Oak Tree Close, 4 houses for workers on the College's Estate. Bearing in mind the huge developements in Wellesbourne the village has changed very little. It has responded minimally to the desire of those wishing to live away from towns. Because of the lack of facilities the County Council, prompted by a strong Parish Council, has not been keen to see any large scale development.
